reviewText: I agree with some others here that this needs to be on DVD. If Mr. Greed can do it for about $12 (instead of the typical $20-plus on many of thes re-releases) then I'll be glad to add it to my collection. This is a nicely entertaining film that sort of crosses "Things To Do In Denver" with "O Brother." Anwar is a real beauty whom I never tire of watching.
Title: The Grave VHS

reviewText: I recently saw this late at night on TV and was surprised at how good it was (I wasn't expecting much)--and now I'm disappointed that it can't be found on DVD. It's basically a treasure-hunt movie, with the gold under (what else?) a grave in the swamps somewhere down South. The story may lack originality, but the dialogue and acting are fantastic. A cameo appearance by Eric Roberts in which he describes how his wife shoots him is absolutely hilarious. Even 80s-era teen star Anthony Michael Hall, playing an ex-con undertaker, finally plays a role well. Amazing. All in all, this is a very entertaining film.
Title: The Grave VHS

reviewText: Really good movie its a shame it hasn't come out on DVD or Blu-ray I bought the VHS tape so I could transfer to dvd.. it was worth it..
Title: The Grave VHS

reviewText: The Grave is about two convicts played by Craig Sheffer (Fire In The Sky, Dracula II: Ascension) and Josh Charles (Coldblooded, SWAT) who bust out of the prison with the help from a security guard, that is John Diehl (Jurassic Park 3, Fail Safe(2000). The 2 escape to find fortunes in a grave but Charles is shot, so Sheffer takes him to Anthony Michael Hall (Weird Science, The Breakfast Club), Donal Louge (Blade, Reindeer Games) and Max Perlich (Drugstore Cowboy, Tv's Buffy The Vampire Slayer) for help. Things go off schedule as Charles dies, Sheffer is left for dead and the  rascals Perlich, Louge and Hall try to figure things out. Sheffer isnt dead, Perlich gets killed and the 3 (Hall, Sheffer and Louge) find the fortunes but things get even more twisted as they are locked in the secret room and then the fit really hits the shan from there. This is told by a voiceboxed mystery person and Keith David (Pitch Black, Requiem For A Dream) is along for the ride. Now this movie began dumb and ended dumb because it was so damn perdictable because I knew off the bat who the voiceboxed person was, it was the chick damnit! The chick was played by Gabrielle Anwar (The Guilty, Things To Do In Denver When Your Dead). Also starring Eric Roberts (National Security, The Specialist) and Giovanni Ribisi (Suburbia, The Mod Squad). Not much fun and they didnt eat any posums at all, why not!!!
summary: a movie that makes graverobbing less interesting
Title: The Grave VHS

reviewText: Brilliant late 90's film. I had an ex-co worker tape this for me he fell in love with it too.Why isn't this on dvd?Kushner/Locke should read the reviews here and see how in demand and popular this film is,Totally great cast,storyline  scary good.A soundtract that you won't get out of your mind anytime soon ,DOYLE LAWSON and QUICKSILVER.Craig Sheffer who also starred in 80's chick flicks like BABYCAKES stars with real life one-time wife Gabrielle Anwar from BURN NOTICE the stylish,smart Miami cool ex spy show. THE GRAVE shows how greed, ignorance,and no honor amongst thieves doesn't mix.There are many current films that don't deserve to be on dvd,this does so what gives? I wish they could explain why they,the owners of the copyrighted material don't feel they can't make a ton of money off of this movie. THEY CAN!! ,put this on dvd, whoever owns the rights to this and watch what happens.
summary: SLICE OF AMERICANA HEAVEN  in  "THE GRAVE".
Title: The Grave VHS

reviewText: great movie. i was actually trying to track this down on DVD (i don't think it exist) but amazon sent this instead. i eventually happened to be visiting a house with a VHS player and was able to watch the movie again, and still really enjoyed it.
